author: nishant0
content:
uh unless I am missing something I dont think that this is true 
https://github.com/goerli/altona/pull/21 
according to this, genesis will occur on saturday not monday 

According to the spec the first valid state on which to carry out genesis is:
```py
is_valid_genesis_state(candidate_state) is True
```

```py
def is_valid_genesis_state(state: BeaconState) -> bool:
    if state.genesis_time < MIN_GENESIS_TIME:
        return False
    if len(get_active_validator_indices(state, GENESIS_EPOCH)) < MIN_GENESIS_ACTIVE_VALIDATOR_COUNT:
        return False
    return True
```

```py
    state = BeaconState(
        genesis_time=eth1_timestamp + GENESIS_DELAY,
        fork=fork,
        eth1_data=Eth1Data(block_hash=eth1_block_hash, deposit_count=len(deposits)),
        latest_block_header=BeaconBlockHeader(body_root=hash_tree_root(BeaconBlockBody())),
        randao_mixes=[eth1_block_hash] * EPOCHS_PER_HISTORICAL_VECTOR,  # Seed RANDAO with Eth1 entropy
    )
```

`        genesis_time=eth1_timestamp + GENESIS_DELAY`

This is how the genesis time is determined, meaning we determine genesis on only the first valid eth1 block at which its `eth1_block_timestamp + genesis_delay` > `min_genesis_time`

So that means genesis will be on saturday...

author: protolambda
content: <@!476250636548308992> `genesis_time=eth1_timestamp + GENESIS_DELAY` is repeated every eth1 block until the candidate state is valid. But this also seems like we won't know exact genesis time, until the first eth1 block timestamp after the `MIN_GENESIS_TIME` (1593261000)
